Links

Here are some articles and tutorials I recommend. While I don’t necessarily agree with every view at the links below, I think they’re worth reading.

Python

  • A non-magical introduction to Pip and Virtualenv for Python beginners – A great, plain-language introduction to pip and virtualenv.
  • How to submit a package to PyPI – A straightforward guide to creating and submitting a package to PyPI.

D3

  • Scott Murray’s D3 Tutorials – Just about the best introductory D3 tutorials out there.
  • Scott Murray’s Interactive Data Visualization for the Web – Also by Scott Murray, but a more thorough treatment.
  • Over 1000 D3.js Examples and Demos – Amazing list for learning and exploring D3’s capabilities.

Version Control

  • Joe Spolsky’s Hg Init: a Mercurial tutorial – Introduction to Mercurial, particularly for people familiar with Subversion.
  • Merge vs. Rebase – A deep dive into the mysteries of revision control

DevOps

  • Why I left Heroku, and notes on my new AWS setup – Neither platform is a panacea, but this is one view neatly presented.

Raspberry Pi

  • Airplay Speakers with Raspberry Pi – Connect any speakers to the Internet with your Raspberry Pi.
